title.narrative: 1.4 HEALTH AND NUTRITION CARE PRACTICES

description.narrative: 1.4 Parents/caregivers, children and pregnant women benefit from evidence-informed approaches to improve their health and nutrition care practices and behaviors., which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children (aged 0â€“18) and women benefit from quality comprehensive health and nutrition services and practices.

WESTERN AREA RURAL DISTRICT HEALTH MANAGEMENT TEAM

sector.narrative: Adolescent health and wellbeing (including sexual and reproductive health)

Implementation of community based integrated prevention and management of childhood illnesses (e.g. iCCM)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.4 Parents/caregivers, children and pregnant women benefit from evidence-informed approaches to improve their health andnutrition care practices and behaviors.

description.narrative: As the country faced multiple health emergencies that required vaccination drives, UNICEF supported to intensify risk communication and social mobilization efforts that focused on vaccine uptake. Multi-channeled communication based on real-time analysis of misinformation/rumors contributed to the polio campaign coverage exceeding the target (111 percent) and high COVID-19 vaccine acceptance. Cognizant of the need to improve maternal, infant, and young child nutrition (MIYCN) practices, the Social Behaviour Change Communication Strategy and costed plan for MIYCN and media analysis were finalized. This paved the way for the launch and implementation of the Stronger with Breastmilk Only initiative in country.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
